dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gaping hole in the concrete side of a freeway. On the embankment beside the hole BRENDAN FRYE squats, shoulders hunched. His dark eyes behind thin glasses watch the shallow stream of water which flows into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: not more than six inches deep. Just beneath the surface a young woman's pale blue arm in gaudy bracelets bats again the edge of her body like a docked boat. A pebble plinks into the water beside it.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single locker. That same arm, bracelets and all, slips note through the slats, then leaves quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cage empties a lone figure slumps to the locker. Opens it. The note falls to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure is Brendan. He unfolds the note (folded in a triangle) -- "12:30 PICO & ALEXANDER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pico and Alexander.2

dialogues.speaker: A WRIST WATCH
dialogues.text: 12:43.   Brendan looks up from the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits on the curb of a wide suburban street, eats lunch from a brown bag and watches a phone booth on the corner. shows no surprise when it begins to ring. Brendan goes to the phone and puts the receiver to his ear. Silence for a moment, then a thin female voice from the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Originally Dode was later revealed to have been hiding ab 2 The street names were changed in production to match exis afford to create custom street signs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Yeah. How's things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow, deliberate) Status quo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice thins to a high, strained breath. She is crying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through strained crying) It's good to see you, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's eyes glance around the surrounding street. Emil is crying again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (CONT'D) (cont'd) It's been some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I didn't even know your locker. I had to ask Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More crying noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em, why don't we meet somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I screwed up real bad. I really screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwed up how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blubbering, fast and incoherent) I did what she said with the brick, I didn't know it was bad, but the pin's on it now for poor Frisco and they're playing it all on me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down now, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta help me Brendan I think tug- Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sharp breath the line clicks dead just as a black mustang roars by. Brendan drops the receiver and spins ou of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, another pay phone up the hill -- empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan turns to the black mustang, far down the street. man's hand drops a cigarette butt from the driver side window.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mustang turns the corner, gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks after it, finds the cigarette butt on the street. Still smoking. A pale blue arrow is printed on the filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance the class bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high school is open air - the hallways are alleyways between buildings. A short kid with eyeglasses the size o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Because of the orientation of the street, this was all fl hand came from the passenger window. The dialogue in the changed to match, causing mass confusion for about half a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volkswagen headlights sits against the wall. Brendan ente leans on the wall beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Brendan. It's been awhile. Where you been eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Yeah, no one's seen you. What's it been, a couple months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's been awhile. You gave Emily my locker number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days ago. Was I wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To give it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been so long, I don't know you two's stats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been awhile.   Who's she been eating with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) I dunno. It's hard to keep track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain avoids Brendan's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't been doing too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well. I'm not looking for a patch up. Em's life is her own. But she asked for my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't even care, it's not my business. I just want to know she's ok, so I've got to find her. That's all this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I know she was poking in with the Ivy-bound cheerleading elite. Laura Dannon's crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the parking lot a beautiful girl with dark long ha kisses an football player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura Dannon there with the Rabbit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Brad Bramish with her. Cream on the upper crust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad laughs heartily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) He's a sap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't argue then. Anyway Em tagged after them for a bit, but it didn't work. So she picked her way down the food chain. Last I seen she was with whasshername, that drama vamp. Small time dealer, augh, the evil one, the one you dated-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her locker number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Brain. Keep your specs on, find me if she shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain trots off. In the distance Brad and Laura laugh and he kisses her. Her hair blows in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Locker 239 is open, its door swinging gently in th wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits against the massive building, flipping throu loose papers. He finds two photographs, one of Emily hugg him, the other of Emily with a beautiful sharp-eyed girl a party, drinks in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorting more papers, he finds a red card with a sequined mask on the front. The bottom edge has been torn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixth period has broke. Masses of students pile into buss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge chunk of brown building. Brendan strides towards i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drama people sit on the floor facing the stage. Brendan steps behind one, the sharp-eyed girl from the picture. S holds a freshman boy's head in her lap. Pets it like a do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Brendan, her face in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a mocking smile) Hello, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to see the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kisses the freshman's forehead, purring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. (nudges the freshman with his toe) Lapdog, blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freshman sits up, looks to Kara like a spooked puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the lapdog) Stay. (to Brendan) Don't be mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all friendly. (to the lapdog) Watch your head, kid - that thing bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog pops up again. Kara pulls him down and nuzzles hi ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (CONT'D) (cont'd) I need words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Emily Kostich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops nuzzling a little too quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Get me my purse. (he goes) Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a trot. Kara smiles at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still picking your teeth with freshmen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a freshman once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides her fingers up his arm. He growls and pushes t away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way once, sister. You and Em were tight for a bit. Who's she eating with now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eating with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eating with. Lunch.           Who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cutie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you're up from the underneath then. The whole Jerr thing blown over. Lucky strikes, you and your partner get bulled, you come up clean. But I guess you were always the brains of the outfit.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 One of many instances of an allusion to the Jerr backstor trimmed back in the editing process for clarity. The auth a stand alone short story, but probably never will, so in Emily were still an item she started hanging out with Jer didn't approve, so he partnered up with Jerr then ratted found out, and that led to their breakup on the field, wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder why I dumped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing to go) God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where she's at, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do, so why don't you want me to find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm looking out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going) Well I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan... you looking to get back into things? I could use you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is gone.   Behind Kara, the play goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The play is seen in shadow-play through the backdrop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slips in through an exit door, crosses the backst area and enters the dressing rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramped and empty. Pictures of Kara with friends are stuc in the mirror. Brendan roughly searches drawers, bags, pockets... nothing. He stops. A red edge behind one of th photos - the same red card with a mask on it, but whole. Across the bottom in small print: "Halloween in January - Call for DETAILS - 555-2394"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls a phone across his desk and dials the numbe on the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, ma'am, this is Tom, I'm a friend from school. Could I speak to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Oh, hi Tom. Laura's here, hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling for details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Details about the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then I don't think you're invited to my party. It's a rather exclusive gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can imagine. (she starts to speak, he cuts her off) You should really work on your invite management. That might be a personal 'room for improvement' area in your life. But discretion of your invite sending aside, I have procured a certain someone's invitation, and would like details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're cute, whoever you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait'll you get a load of my felt fedora and spats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Or I'll hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me - I'll save you some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everyone and I've got all the time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folly of youth. Ask whose invitation I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly) What you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily Kostich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 Bush street, up in Stockton Cove. Buzz 42 at the gate. Nine o'clock. But who-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up. He folds his hands under his chin and stares at the phone, perfectly still. The clock on his de says 4:53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan at his desk, tapping away at Tetris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8:30 The desk is empty, Tetris paused. A shower runs behind an ajar door in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing private community gate. Brendan coasts up on bike and ditches it in the bushes. He checks the call box directory: "42 -- DANNON"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the call box as a hand hold he hops the gate and wa briskly up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shiny cars line the curb. Party noises come from an upsca two story house. Brendan takes a short breath, then strid up to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and clean, with a two story ceiling and a railed staircase at one end. Fifteen or twenty clean people, som in costumes, mill about in cliques. Brendan comes in as i he doesn't mind who sees him coming in. He gets a couple stares, but no one stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With non obtrusive confidence he cuts through the crowd t the beer keg in back and draws half a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richly adorned, crowded, lit with bright pools of light. Brendan drifts in and stands in the back, deep in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music comes from a baby grand piano set against one wall. Laura Dannon leans against it. She wears a red kimono, and is striking against the velvet black piano. Laura's kid sister, 11 years old with glasses, sits at th piano playing "All I do is Dream of You".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sings, lovely and soft but with strength.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan watches from the back, his face obscured in shado but his eyes gleam. Through the darkened window behind hi a match flares up, and someone standing outside lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura finishes the song. The room applauds, and she ruffl her kid sister's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan ducks out, and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 By the time we got around to production this had changed Me," but the publishing rights proved too expensive (i.e. & Sullivan song, which besides being lovely was also

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad Bramish, the jock who was kissing Laura in the parki lot, sits slouched on the couch in a dense crowd. He hold cup and speaks much too loudly to a guy named Biff at his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the coach wants to play me I'll play, but I can't put my best game in if I've got to worry about whether I'm going to be in there. Halftime last game, coach is pissed I ran it on a pass play, out on the field he says to me 'you gotta think about the team and you gotta' you know and 'if you run that ball again you're out', and I said to him you gotta let me play! I'm out there, let me play, and he's saying 'no you're out' and I kept saying 'Let me play! Let me play! Let me play!', just right in his face-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'Let me play! Let me play! Let me play!' 'No you gotta' 'No, let me play! Let me play! Let me play!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad hunches forward, his face swollen purple, yelling th over and over. Tom steps in front of Brendan, blocking hi line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan scans the rest of the room. His eyes catch on Lau leaning against a divan. Her bright, sharp eyes cut throu the room, straight into Brendan. He wags his eyebrows at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks away quickly. Brendan turns back to Brad, still shouting 'let me play'. Tom stands between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad falls silent. Most of the room follows suit. Tom tur around. Brendan smiles good naturedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) Could you step aside, please? I'm trying to follow Brad's story, and it's difficult when I can't see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room watches Brendan. Tom mumbles something and steps aside. Brad stares at Brendan stupidly. Brendan flashes a dopey grin and tips his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbles) He doesn't give me a play to make, what can I do, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls into awkward silence. Biff starts babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at Brad, who is staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan then slowly drags his gaze over to Laura, staring him too, her eyes slightly amused. Brendan cocks an eyebr The slightest hint of a smile takes the corner of her mou and she wags her eyebrows once at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan glances back at Brad, looking at Laura now, not amused at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands to go. Biff chatters on. Brad cuts him off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD (cont'd) Hey. Hey! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Unless your anecdote's got a 2nd act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving) That's what I was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a lit wet bar at one end. Brendan goes to the bar, p ice in a glass and cracks it with liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) Whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pauses, glass touching his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jameson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a man who knows what he's drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty sick thing to be attracted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's not a good guy to get on the wrong side of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other in silence. She studies his face The broken light of the bar makes her features seem liqui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fearless flyer. Quit your yappin and fix me one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and slips out a sliding glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fills another glass with whiskey and cuts his with wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan joins Laura, hands her a drink. Suburban lights f the valley below. Laura sips her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never get through all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sips more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew your old partner Jerr since grade school. Tough break. How long were you two joined up before your operation got the sting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few months. Could have helped himself out by turning me in, but he took the heat. He was a good guy. Solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I did. So why are you here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had an invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well like you said, I've got to work on that. Em's been AWOL for a good month, nobody's seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly nobody's seen her. So what did she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winces) Score 0 for finesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you're scratching at the wrong door. I wasn't with Emily enough to know details of what she was in, I just got wind of the downfall, and I didn't get any details of that, except that it was bad. So now that we're showing some cards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you haven't got a finger in Em's troubles, why'd her name get me into your rather exclusive party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up with me now. I don't know, but it sounded like you did, and a body's got a right to be curious. Now I'm not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll put that body to bed. I don't know a damn thing about whatever troubles, and that works for me. I just want to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Laura studies Brendan's face, then seems to come to a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee and pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words hang in the air a moment. A look of recognition from Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee and pie oh my?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't hear it from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sips his drink. A voice calls from the glass door. Another girl. Laura flashes Brendan a look and goes to he They have quick, quiet words and the girl leaves. Laura turns back to Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (CONT'D) (cont'd) Will you wait here for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stay right here and wait -- I'll be five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment she leaves Brendan runs across the lawn and ho the fence, into the neighbor's yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan runs to the edge of the neighboring house and pee around. Laura comes out the front door, cuts across the lawn and sidewalk and trots out into the street. Brendan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begins to follow, but a noise from behind the fence stops him - a match being struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan creeps towards the fence and peers through a splintered hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brightly lit window in the side of Brad's house, and through the window the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark figure wearing a long coat and broad rimmed hat, a inky black. The figure smokes a cigarette and watches the party, absently stroking his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan steps back - SNAP!   A twig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure freezes. Then, making no noise at all, it spin to face Brendan, a towering black form against the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing cigarette falls to the grass. A metallic glint, and a clicking sound not unlike a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan throws himself backwards onto the grass. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the hole the black of the figure's cloak whips aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hesitates, then hops the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan lands on his feet. No black figure to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cigarette still smolders on the ground. Hand rolled, plain paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gazes through the window, catching his breath. Th he breaks the trance and creeps towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeking around the house, Brendan sees Laura cut across t lawn and trot into the street. Using parked cars as cover Brendan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between cars, Brendan sees a lanky kid in baggy jeans and engineer boots with a clean shaven head leaning against a black Mustang. Laura goes to him and speaks quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark figure in the hat emerges from the shadows. Laur says something to him. Grunting something angrily, he get in the car with the bald kid and peels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura turns and slowly walks towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she is gone Brendan stands, throws a look back at th house and walks off down the street, towards the guard ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two drinks, where Brendan left them. Laura takes hers and drains it. The suburban lights twinkle like stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over Carrows family restaurant, a squat structure backed against the weedy edge of the runoff tun ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner from 1973 in the window - "Coffee and Pie oh my! A pack of six pale stoners slump against the rear dumpste Their beady eyes follow Brendan in sync as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the nearest one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno, bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence and blank stares. Brendan calmly moves to the nex stoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan moves to the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin head pokes from around the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Brendan. Maybe you shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan steps around the dumpster. Dode slumps against th wall, thin and delicate in dusty black. Slivery eyes, pal lips, muffled intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara told me you know where Em's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.   And why are you looking for Em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked for my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Listen man, I've got plenty on my plate without dealing with some jilted ex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it's about, act smarter than you look and drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with me, and right now that's the best place for her. Leave the low life to the low lifers and dangle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on the bright side of dim, Dode, but if I thought you had this half- handled I'd be eating lunch. Where's she at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get while it's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan doesn't. DODE (cont'd) Heel it now, dig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 5 big stoners appear behind Brendan, threatening.   D turns his head away to light a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's fist slams into his face, sending the joint spinning. Brendan slams Dode's frail frame against the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 5 stoners stand in the exact same position, deer in t headlights. One makes a half hearted motion to intervene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw one at me if you want, hash head. I've got all five senses and I slept last night, that puts me six up on the lot of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just easy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slams Dode into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dode) Where's Em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deliberate) She's with me. She was tight when she called you, man. Came to and freaked. She told me to shake you if you came by. Said you'd only make things worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan covers how shaken he is by this statement fairly well. He drops Dode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him down, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal with whatever this ain't about and drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brendan) Nothing more here, bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Emily I want to see her. Tell her if she still wants my help or not that's her business, but I want to hear it straight from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today. She knows where I eat lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Brendan is a safe distance away the biggest stoner shouts with conviction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stay out, punk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hides behind a tall clump of bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later Dode hustles away from Carrows. Brendan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is rising as Brendan tails Dode through the twist suburban streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan takes cover as Dode stops by a white hatchback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl gets out of the car and embraces Dode. Her wrist i adorned with the same cheap plastic bracelets as the dead girl's arm. Dode speaks quickly to her, she nods and spea back. He hands her a slip of paper, which she tucks into brightly colored address book and slips in her jacket pocket. They embrace again, Dode walks off and the girl g in her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stumbles after the car, but it is quickly gone. H watches it go, then follows Dode back towards school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode slumps into the front door of the brown building. Brendan watches him from a distance, eyes thoughtful. Aft a beat he turns and walks off into the thickening crowds students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan eats lunch alone on a concrete wall beside a long empty utility road behind the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reclining on the wall, reading "Lord of the Flies". He raises his eyes, and sits up suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off in the distance on the utility road a tiny figure approaches, stumbling. Brendan jumps and hits the ground running towards the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet the girl with cheap bracelets, the girl Dode spoke t the dead girl, Emily. He catches her just as she stumbles and falls and carries her into the shade of a covered hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily and Brendan sit in silence. She is very pretty, but she looks bad. Too much makeup, not enough sleep. She sniffles, speaks to her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have sounded pretty crazy on the phone. Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She taps her shoes together lightly, eyes fixed on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (cont'd) It was dumb, I got paranoid over a really stupid thing. I was high, I went crazy for a little bit, but now you have to forget about it. Please. That's how you can help me now, forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her weak eyes to Brendan for the first time. stare is unwavering, searching. She pushes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (cont'd) Brendan, I know you're mad at all these people, cause you think I went away from you and went to them. But you've got to start seeing it as my decision, stop being angry because where I want to be at's different from where you wanna be at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Who fed you that line, Em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stop picking on Dode. He's a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carrows rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained anger) Yeah, what are you? Eating back here, not liking anybody, how are you judging anyone? I loved you alot but I couldn't stand it, I had to get with people. I couldn't heckle life with you, I had to see what was what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. She taps her clogs. One has a hole worn through t sole. Her face contorts, seizes up, and she is sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (cont'd) I'm sorry Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She buries her face in his shoulder. He has a hard time speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to come back to me, Em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Never. I'm sorry. Never. I can't love on your terms, Brendan. I can't do that, I'm not like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a spot, I can get you out of it. Come back to me, and whatever heat follows you I'll deal with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're not hearing me, no. I don't want to be put away and protected. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (cont'd) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the trouble, the brick and the pin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna fix things like you did with Jerr? No. I came to say goodbye, for good. Whatever you have to do to let me go, do it. I'm gonna let you go, I've

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: decided that. Make sure that, you've got to, promise you won't torture yourself, that you'll let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She embraces him, enveloping him in her jacket. His face a frozen mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY (cont'd) Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she pulls away he mechanically slips an address book f her jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her as she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits in the back, flipping through the address bo The teacher drones on about the significance of the pig's head in "Lord of the Flies".1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegible scribbles, names, numbers, nothing that stops h search - then the note Dode gave her, a corner of loose-l paper which looks like this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan studies the paper intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain studies the paper. Busses pull into the parking lot behind them. Brendan is distant, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. Do you know anything else about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Our one and only scene in a classroom was moved to Brenda a location change. The degree to which the lack of classr commented on has always bemused the author, who cannot fo remember a single interesting thing that happened in a cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim pickings. Why'd you let Dode fly when he came back to whose-her-name, at the theater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs dismissively) Kara. It's their turf, I couldn't hear them without being seen, and that would only biff their play. Best to know it's there, let it ride and see what comes of it. (touches the paper) But anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. Well, if this is what I think it is, it didn't come straight from Dode, less he's playing out of his league. (beat) I can only give you my best guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the upper crust does shady deeds they do them in different spots around town. I know under the pier's one, down by the bike trails in the state park's another. There's alot of them. The pitch is they've got little symbols for each one, and that's how they tell each other the place, so word won't get around. So this might be that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dode wouldn't know it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is upper crust. Dode's pie pan grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan studies the symbol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call anything up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many places start with 'A'? Or if it's a shape, or just a random symbol. Anyway, even if you figured it out, what good could you do? She's smart, she knows the play, she's gunning to square things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said her business was none of yours, so she's alright, forget it now. Go home, sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparsely furnished. Brendan plays Tetris on his computer, staring off into space. His mom's voice calls "Good night and the hallway light turns off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10:30 by the clock radio on Brendan's nightstand. The sli of paper rests beside it. Brendan lies in bed, staring at the symbol on the paper. His eyes tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing larger, burning with a searing intensity, then folding into darkness. Water rushes overhead, over concre concrete with a hole in it -- the runoff tunnel, just for instant, then back underwater, screaming. Brendan choking screaming, plunging upwards. A woman with no face falls f the darkness and kisses him, her long hair sweeping aroun him then pulling away. As the last strands slide off his face he wakes up with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock says 3:46. Brendan drips with sweat, breathing raggedly. He takes the paper and a pencil from the nightstand and shades the symbol to look like this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH CUT - The runoff tunnel, lining up perfectly with t now shaded symbol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes turn uneasy as he removes his glasses and clicks off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks off into the hazy pre-dawn light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stops at a high wall of weeds, listening to the l gurgle of moving water. Slowly, robotically he pushes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face down, bobbing gently in shallow water. Bluish white. Red foam clings to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silently, as if lowered by a string Brendan sinks down, squatting in the mud. His lungs empty in one choppy breat He pulls his glasses off sluggishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifeless, pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A contorted, frozen mask, eyes wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stringy, flowing gently in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, drifting... then suddenly snapping to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise. From the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan freezes. The inky blackness of the tunnel mouth opens like a vacuum... silent, but then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scrape of a shoe against concrete, then echoing footsteps running away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan springs like a cat, sprinting into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly pitch black. 2 sets of running footfalls. Brendan chasing, running full speed into the blackness, heart pounding - we almost don't notice that Brendan's are now only footfalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan notices. He stops. Silence in the darkness, excep for Brendan's breath... and someone near...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Brendan takes a fist in the cheek and goes down. An inky black figure steps from the shadows and kicks him in the stomach. Brendan curls on the ground, the figure over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low whisper) Your little Em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure runs off. Brendan raises his head painfully - figure is silhouetted briefly against the distant bright of the tunnel, then is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily's body is still there. Brendan crawls out of the tunnel and collapses in the shallow water, beside the bod He rests his head on his arm, eyes on Em's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold and barren, nearly empty. Brendan limps across the barren lawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of phone booths on campus. Brendan nearly collapse against one. He dials, still in a stupor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Clement police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stares into space, eyes burning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE ON PHONE (cont'd) Saint Clement police, hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning mist below a squat brick building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warmly lit, sheltering the few souls scattered here and there at tables. The Brain sits at one of them reading an impossibly large book. He watches curiously as Brendan approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan falls into a chair. The Brain looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BRAIN (cont'd) You're up early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick, distant) I couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, back to his book) Find Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan breathes out softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BRAIN (cont'd) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What, are you here for zero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I gotta take the early bus, cause the others don't run by my street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh. Time to read's nice. So what's the word with Em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't raise her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. I don't know. I guess it's... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan takes a long moment. He stares down at his glasse wet with condensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) Brain, I can't let her go. I was set to but I can't. I don't think I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can help her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can get the straight, maybe break some deserving teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara tried to rope me. She came right out and asked. She was scared. Tell me to walk from this, Brain. Tell me to drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk from it. Drop it. (grins) You're thick as what-all, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan cleans his glasses. He looks Brain in the eye, an his mannerisms come back into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) I'd need you to Op. Like on Jerr, but that was cake to this. And unlike Jerr, there's not much chance we'll come out clean. Twenty four seven on this one. You okay to op for me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain barely smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What first, tip the bulls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan puts on his glasses, stands to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, bulls would gum it. They'd flash their dusty standards at the wide-eyes and probably find some yegg to pin, probably even the right one. But they'd trample the real tracks and scare the real players back into their holes, and if we're doing this I want the whole story. No cops, not for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Your mom still have the cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrow it for a few days, get me the number. (stands to go) Wait for my word, and cover for me first period. I'm going to be a little late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast field of asphalt segmented by a dozen basketball courts outlined in cracked paint.1 Brendan trudges across it, his steps heavy. He stops and stands very still, star at the ground for a beat then raising his eyes to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flat, gray, pin straight. Brendan's voice starts speaking rapidly, confident and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 This describes the location at my school that the "showdo written for. Between when I wrote the script and when we expanded and built portable classrooms on the basketball moved these scenes to the football field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it was personal. Jerr spooked some decent gees and ran around some what was straight with him, but I'm nobody's bull runner. This wasn't a business sit. But yeah. I bulled him. Got in tight, partnered up and sent him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN AROUND to reveal BRENDAN. He looks different, edgier, more alive, wearing different clothes and a thin goatee1. keeps talking directly at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) I'd bull the lot of them, Em, I'd burn down the whole party if they tried to play you again. Jerr and whoever's next. I want to keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARM swings into frame, wearing cheap plastic bracelets and pale blue fingernail polish. It slaps Brendan hard in the face. He catches it. Emily wrenches her arm away and stumbles backwards onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grabs her sleeve. She twists away. He grabs her shoulder, grabs her waist, she resists, and suddenly they are struggling with violent pent up intensity until with shout she breaks away and falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.     Gulls cry in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep me safe, Brendan. I'm in a bigger world now, and you can't hide me from it, and you can't beat it. Not if I don't want you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's face looks lumpish, while Emily's is strong. Sh stands and walks off into the distance across the barren field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching her go. It is back to present day, pale, clean shaven, sullen. His eyes are cold with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sloshes down into the water. Without delicacy he lifts Emily's body and pulls her back into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Which Joe would not even consider, thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch back. Brendan lays the body down. Two beady eyes pe at him from the darkness - he freezes. The eyes hop forwa - a gull. The two watch each other for a moment, then the gull squawks and flutters out the bright mouth of the tunnel. Brendan follows it without looking back at the body.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and the Brain lean against a wall. The Brain slip him a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the cell number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it on vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats his jacket pocket) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better stop meeting me in the open too. I'm going to start getting visible, and I need you on the underneath. I'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trueman asked for you. Wants words in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet. Keep him off me - stonewall him, he won't bite, just keep him away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try. So what's first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make Em's troubles mine. I'm going to throw a few words at you, tell me if they catch. Brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 A very early draft held on the tunnel after Brendan left, (Dode) creeping away from the top of the tunnel, causing 1 to plink into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or bad brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug... that might be a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka and milk or something, or maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Frisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisco. Frisco Farr1 was a sophomore last year, I think. Real trash, maybe hit a class a week. Didn't know him then, and haven't seen him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pin... the Pin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin's kind of a local spook story. You know the Kingpin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing. Supposed to be old, like 26, lives in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 All apologies to Frisco Farr, who the author did actually was neither a druggie nor `real trash', but was a great g sounding name. He is now (the author was horrified to lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake1 runner, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big time... maybe. Ask any dope rat where their junk sprang they'll say they scraped it from that who scored it from this who bought it off so, and after four or five connections the list'll always end with the Pin. But I'll becha you got every rat in town together and said 'show your hands' if any of them've actually seen the Pin, you'd get a crowd of full pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the Pin's just a tale to take whatever heat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs. Beat) But what's first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A show of hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan strides past forest scenery and drama geeks, thro another door and into sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara smokes a cigarette. Brendan leans beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Hey Brendan. Here for the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you go then, honey, cause I've got this headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try smoking like a chimney, I've heard that helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 In an admittedly paltry concession to clarity, this was c production.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grabs the pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) Isn't this Dode's brand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara snaps her head towards him, a flash of anger. She catches herself and smiles cooly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Dode's brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry again, Kara snatches the pack from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) I'm going to start shaking things up. Give me the story and you might miss the bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to play games if you've got a headache. Get me if you want to spill it, but I can't guarantee safe passage after tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the stage door, not slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the Pin that Brad was my calling card, and I need words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad Bramish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the door and into the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins to see Kara's face just before the door closes. She's worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain walks out of a classroom and Brendan swings beh him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast and low) Tail Kara through lunch. She's got rehearsal but she'll blow early. She goes home, drop her, else wait for my call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain turns and Brendan's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan wanders through the thick lunchtime crowd towards cluster of 3 or 4 flashy luxury cars set aside at the far end of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad Bramish sits slouched in the front seat of his convertible, front door open. A small crowd hangs about Brad, his crony Biff at his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I'm saying, is put me in the game and I'll do what needs to be done, but they don't put me in, what needs doing don't get done and don't come crying to me, man. Get off my grill man, you didn't put me in, don't come to me if you didn't let me play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan scans the rest of the cars. His eyes catch on Lau Dannon sitting in another convertible, off to the side. H bright eyes cut through the crowd, straight into Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wags his eyebrows at her. She looks away. Brendan walk into Brad's direct line of view and obviously leans again one of the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you got me. I'm a scout for the Gophers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused) Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all things, yeah. Been watching your game for a month, but that story just now clenched it. You've got heart, kid. How soon can you move to Minneapolis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few snickers around the crowd, but nowhere near Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat with anger) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold winters, but they've got a great public transit system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a thesaurus in the library. 'Yeah's under 'Y'. Go ahead, I'll wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invited you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the parking lot? Well gee I kind of invited myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better leave then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm having too good a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan smiles slightly, and very deliberately crosses hi legs. Brad's face tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD (cont'd) Maybe you want to go someplace more private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad says 'who else?' by lifting his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) (as if he's been asked to the movies) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands and walks off. Brad follows and the rest o the crowd trails after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them behind a parked VW van and turns to face Br People gather around in a wide circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls his jacket off as Brad hangs back, mumbling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's good for you you'll just beat it. Beating a small frye won't win me anything and it's not going to do you any good-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pulls up in her convertible, behind Brad, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next moment Brendan cuts Brad off by putting his f in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad grunts but doesn't lose ground. Brendan throws his short stocky frame into Brad's larger one and tenderizes midsection with jabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad tags Brendan in the ribs, then smacks the palm of hi hand into Brendan's face, shoving him back onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes at Brendan with his big fists clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan kicks Brad full force in the shins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad tumbles, and Brendan comes up fast, connecting hard with the point of Brad's chin. Brad gets his balance fast and before Brendan can throw another he throws one himsel then another, both into Brendan's stomach. Brendan pulls back and kicks Brad's shin where he had kicked it before. Brad roars and hits Brendan very hard in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan bounces back like a rubber ball and throws his weight into a square punch right into Brad's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of eggs breaking, and Brad falls backwards like board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stays down, holding his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan staggers back, breathing hard, and looks up at th small crowd. Some stare at Brendan, some at Brad, but nob seems about to do anything. Brendan runs his sleeve over face and walks unsteadily off, pushing past the last few people rushing over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is there a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a last look at Laura, who meets his gaze and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks away from the lot, towards the school. Laur pulls up beside him in her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan ignores her and b-lines for the school. Laura bra hard, parking by the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan limps down the hallway.    Laura appears behind h trotting to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite a pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you take a powder the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same reason I'm taking one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. (he keeps walking) I don't get you. That's a chilly heel to be giving a girl who's where you want to know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get where I'm going just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence behind him. He stops, turns wearily. She looks genuinely hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (CONT'D) (cont'd) Look, I can't trust you. You ought to be smart enough to know that. I didn't shake the party up to get your attention, and I'm not heeling you to hook you. Your connections could help me, but the bad baggage they bring could make it zero sum game or even hurt me, so I'm better off coming at it clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have to lead you in by the hand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't trust you. Brad was a sap, you weren't, you were with him and so you were playing him, so you're a player. With you behind me I'd have to tie one eye up watching both your hands, and I can't spare it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks away. She doesn't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slumps against it, receiver to his ear, licking a bruised lip. He wears dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) You didn't call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Kara went home though, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she stopped at a payphone and made two calls that she didn't want on her phone bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the numbers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'alright. Are me and Brad front page news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the buzz. You really do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Is Brad the Pin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's a sap. I downed him on his field and his crew didn't bite. So now I know he's a sap and anyone who acts like he isn't is profiting by it. That's not why I roughed him, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For kicks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Economics. Brad's the school's biggest jake buyer, so if this Pin is behind all the selling, I just got his attention. Anyway, now's just shaking things out. Look, you know a kid around the burgh, lanky, short, shaved head, turns a black tang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you before I don't know the car. Those types are a nickel a pound, but nobody I know that you don't. And Trueman again-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him off. And keep your specs on - I need to find that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up and turns sluggishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lanky kid with a short shaved head and engineer boots punches him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hits the pavement. The lanky kid is over him in a split second, beating his face and body with short, heavy blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashes of the lanky kid - a shiny scar shaped like a thi triangle runs down the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a brief silent thrashing the kid walks off with several other blurry figures. A car peels out and roars o O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan lies still. The class bell rings, very distant. L criss cross before his eyes, each blurring the world a bi more until it is completely smeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits with an ice pack against his head in a tiny office. A man in his early thirties behind a wood colored

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: desk and name plate, "GARY TRUEMAN, ASSISTANT VICE PRINCIPAL" plays with a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know this boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, never seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he just hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, he asked for my lunch money first. Good thing I brown bagged it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trueman trains a good natured dubious eye on Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Brendan. I've been looking to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUEMAN (cont'd) You've helped this office out before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I gave you Jerr to see him eaten, not to see you fed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, and well put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accelerated English, Mrs. Kasprzyk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough teacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough but fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. Anyway then, we know you're clean, and you've, despite your motives, you've been an asset to us. I think you're a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to run a couple names by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUEMAN (cont'd) We're not done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) I was done here three months ago. I told you then I'd give you Jerr and that was that, I'm not your inside line and I'm not your boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a very helpful-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anger builds) You know what I'm in if the wrong yeg saw me pulled in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And no more of these informal chats - if you've got a discipline issue with me write me up or suspend me and I'll see you at the parent conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, I could - hold it - could write you up for talking back to a VP. For looking at me in a threatening way. I'd exercise a little more tact, Mr. Frye. You can't pull a play like that unless I need you for something. So do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe you're gonna need me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Alright, I need you off my back completely for a few weeks. There might be some heat soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested) If it's something I can't cover, I won't go to bat for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get caught like that it's curtains anyway - I couldn't have brass cutting me favors in public. I'm just saying now so you don't come kicking in my homeroom door once trouble starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trueman bites a thumbnail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what I can do. I won't pin you for anything you aren't caught at. I'll ride it a little while, as long as it doesn't get too rough. But if anything comes up with your fingerprints on it, I can't help you. Also, if I get to the end of whatever this is and it gets hot and you don't deliver, The Veep will need someone to hand over, police- wise. And I'll have you. There better be some meat at the end of this like you say, or at least a fall guy, or you're it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I am. Got one more favor to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Trueman throws Brendan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell off my campus, punk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan glances around, and limps off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No stoners, no Dode. Brendan breathes uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan leans against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dode's MIA all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 9 of 10 that Kara's got him, but who knows where. I shook but she's not spilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more job offers? So she's got a play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know enough about Kara to let that worry me. Alright, keep your specs on for him. Any other news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some. Laura Dannon came to me looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers this) She did, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth period, nearly shook me upside down. Can't say I didn't enjoy it, but why'd she come to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tapping Kara, and Kara knows you know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. She's some piece of work. If I had known where you were I might have told her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the spirit. Ask around for Dode, tail Kara again at lunch. I got knives in my eyes, I'm going home sick. I'll call you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordering a supermarket. Brendan trudges along. Suddenly stops. Parked in the supermarket parking lot is a black mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hangs low. Brendan approaches the car and walks around it slowly. He peers inside. A tuft of paper pokes from under the seat. He pulls the door handle, locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan picks up a broken chunk of concrete from the grou waddles over to the car and holds the chunk above his hea ready to drop it through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops. His eyes catch something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lanky shaved-head kid, whose name is Tugger.   Coming towards him fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands there for a moment, then lets the chunk fa to the ground. He casually leans against the car, removes his glasses, puts them in a hard case and puts the hard c in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger hits him like a train and throws him across the pavement. Tug turns back to the car and takes out his key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gets up and comes towards Tug, his face stiff. Tu turns and pops him once squarely in the mouth. Brendan fa to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Tug unlocks the door Brendan stands up woozily. Grunting, Tug spins and grabs Brendan's jacket, pushing h back while he slaps him hard in the face, back and forth, three times. When Tug lets go Brendan drops like a stone, catching himself on his hands and knees. The car door sla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mustang drives about a hundred yards out into the parking lot, spins around and stops, facing Brendan. Its motor purrs deeply. Brendan begins to limp towards it doggedly, head up, eyes fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crackling roar and short squeal of tires spit the musta forward. It comes straight at Brendan, rumbling like a ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stops walking and stands very still, eyes steady. The gap between him and the car closes in no time at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It speeds past him not six inches to his left, brushing t edge of his jacket. Brakes squeal behind him. Brendan tur and lopes towards the mustang, idling about fifty feet aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops at the window.   Tugger eyes him curiously, with some respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the Pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods slightly) Yeah, I guess you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisty and narrow. The black mustang flies through them a impossible speeds, roaring past like a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud engine noise, jostling, grunting. Then a metallic jangle, some scraping, and a CLINK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk pops open, revealing Brendan holding a jack rod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug is putting a tape in the deck, eyes down. Behind him the trunk pops open, then pulls down out of sight just as looks back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan holds the trunk about three inches open, just eno to see which street signs pass by. Loud music plays from car -- "Sweet Baby James" by James Taylor.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car zooms on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the ajar trunk. The mustang slides to a stop besi an elaborate wooden mailbox carved as an eagle's head. Brendan closes the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small one story house, slightly run down. Tugger opens trunk and drags Brendan out, covering his eyes with a pal slams the trunk and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they are gone the broken trunk drifts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very dim narrow hall with a steep stairway at one end, dark doors down the length of it and a lit door at the ot end. Tugger drags Brendan down the stairway, drops him an goes into the lit room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Unfortunately Mr. Taylor flatly refused, which, given the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan lifts his head painfully. Surrounding him in the darkened doorways are dozens of boys, some dressed like Tugger, others dressed in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug pokes his head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arms pop out of the darkness and drag Brendan towards the lit room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room, amazingly messy. Clothes strewn about, grov of empty bottles, precarious piles of books. The overall impression though is not of jumbled chaos, but of a nest, comfortably woven and very worn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slim figure with wispy hair sits facing the wall at a small desk, writing under a green bookkeeper's lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan is shoved into the center of the room. Tug and hi clones slump against the surrounding walls. Brendan watch the thin figure's back. For a beat the only noise is the scratching of the thin man's pencil. Then he sighs and swivels around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
