dialogues.text: Mid to late twenties. Sallow features, tired eyes. His clothes are so richly black it is difficult to make out specific items -- he is just one inky black mass from the neck down and eyebrows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the Pin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat of silence) So now I'm very very curious what you're going to say next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just sit and bleed at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin shifts in his seat, bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helled if you're gonna go breaking my best clients' noses and expect me to play sandbag. Anyway you've been sniffing me out before then, sniffing for me like a vampire bat for a horse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with a nick on its ear he can suck on. They do that. (Brendan blinks) So now you got Tugger to bring you here, which he never does, and you got me listening, so I'm curious what you've got to say that better be really, really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Ms. Dannon in from the hall first; she oughta hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) No dice, soldier. Would have been a neat trick, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, then slowly) I was going to make up some bit of information or set up some phony deal, anything so you'd let me walk. Then I was going to go to the vice principal and spill him the street address of the biggest dope port in the burgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin's eyes shoot to Tugger, who doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows zippo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1250 Vista Blanca, the ink blotter at the desk in the den in the basement of the house with the tacky mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world turns on its side as Tugger pushes Brendan's he down into the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna do what now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin walks towards them. One of his shoes is twice the size of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cronies around the room begin cackling. Tug's face is mask of rage. Brendan can't breath. His face swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) Alright, let up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tug doesn't let up. Brendan's world grows hazy, the cackling laughter reverberates, then a clean voice pierce the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Tug, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug's face breaks for a moment, and he lets go. Brendan's head lolls to the side. Laura stands in the dark doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sees Tug's knuckles and a flash of white for a sp moment as Tug hits him in the face. The Pin's black body spills out across the frame, leaving us in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan wakes up curled on a mattress on the floor. A bar light bulb hangs from the ceiling. Tugger sits five feet away, watching him like a hungry dog. Brendan stares back him through thick, glazed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my glasses? (Tugger grins) Hell with ya then. Which wall's the door in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug points, amused. Brendan heaves himself up, and Tug shoves him back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan winks at him, stands and lurches towards the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger grabs his shirt and slams him into the wall, but freezes when he hears a door latch click. Sneering, he dr Brendan back onto the mattress and sits against the oppos wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of a door opening and closing come from the darkne Light footsteps clack on the cement floor. Suddenly Tug vanishes -- the room's darkness just seems to swallow him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thin whispery voice of the Pin speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this kid, but what the hell with what you said before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His disembodied face appears a few feet about where Tug h sat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) Where you were at, with all of us and the Tug a fist away, you've got to use your nut. Allay the situation, So yeah, you're not scared of me, I got it, but I'm also thinking you're a little nuts now, so you've got that trade off with your standing. But nuts isn't all bad, so maybe it was a good play. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is standing in front of Tug. His black clothes and bro rimmed black hat blend perfectly with the dark room, such that his face seems to bob about in space. Brendan stifle cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) So, Laura talked me down. Let's get you upstairs, back with the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits at a breakfast table eating cornflakes. The kitchen is on the first floor of the Pin's house, or rath the Pin's mother's house. She is a soft old lady in a pas cotton dress, currently bent over the fridge mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had orange juice, Brendan, I'm sorry. How about Tang, or that's more like soda isn't it, or not soda but it hasn't got any juice in it, it can't be very fortifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water's fine, ma'am, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just a moment, we have apple juice here, if you'd like that, or milk, though you've got that in your cornflakes, I don't know if drinking it as well might be too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apple juice sounds terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's country style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the fridge. Tugger and the Pin sit behind her, looking comfortably bored. The Pin, a sharp black hole against the soft yellow kitchen, eats oatmeal cookies wit small delicate bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll even give it to you in a country glass, how'd that be? Boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Mrs. M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well I'm going to go, um, do something in the other room now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuffles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brendan) So hows bout we take another snap at hearing your tale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It starts out same as before, and this floor ain't carpeted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're cooled off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, your muscle seemed plenty cool putting his fist in my head. I want him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin grins thinly, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looky, soldier-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ape blows or I clam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands violently) So clam! What've you got I can't beat out of you back in the basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin and Brendan are perfectly still, watching each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a few minutes, Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug turns to him, but Pin keeps his eyes on Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) I'll call you if whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Tug stomps off, slamming the narrow door hard behin him. The Pin goes back to gnawing his cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sets down his spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a year ago I had a small time dealing partnership with Jerr Madison. Know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till he took the fall for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well. I didn't ask him to, but he was a straight player. I got out clean - almost. Nothing on my official record, but the VPs play it like I owe them one. When I made it clear I wasn't playing their hound dog, well they didn't like it. They keep calling me in, badgering me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee that's tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like being told whose side I'm on. So now they think I'm on your trail, I'm in a nice spot to know their movements and feed them yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't got me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering the benefits my services could yield, I don't think that's unreasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are your services exactly, just so I can be specific on the invoice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Whatever serves your interests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. I'll have my boys check your tale, and seeing how it stretches we'll either rub or hire you. You'll know which by end of the day tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands but doesn't follow as the Pin opens the narrow door Tugger went through and descends the dark sta behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment the Pin vanishes into the basement's murk Laur comes up out of it. She takes Brendan's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They zig zag though the twisty suburban streets. Brendan stares sullenly into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drop me at school. (they take a hard turn) How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half an hour. It took all of it for me to cool the Pin down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly, but sincerely) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's convertible stops, and Brendan climbs out painful He studies her face for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less than when I didn't trust you before. If you can tell me your angle in this, maybe I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan leans on the car, his face close to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (CONT'D) (cont'd) I'm on the in, top level of the tower and I know everyone, but I don't know all what goes on. I knew Em when she tried to get with me and Brad, and I liked her. She was smart. But she wasn't us, and it didn't work. When she left she took some souvenirs, dirty habits she wasn't strong enough to control and a connection to the Pin to keep them going. With me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few months go by, and the next I hear the Pin's raging over a situation with some certain junk Em was partial to, and the downfall's coming on Em's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Em scraped the junk off the Pin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Not to weasel in a plug, but the original version of this deleted scenes section of the DVD. Available at fine reta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but whether she scraped or copped or just ran her tab around the world and into her own back, it must have been grand. I've never seen the Pin so hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all helps but it's not what I asked. What's your angle in all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm usually pretty sharp, but... maybe I see what you're doing for Emily, trying to help her. And I don't know anyone who would do that for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throwing the car in gear, she peels out and leaves him standing alone in the fading evening light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pushes through the gloom, past forest scenery, deeper and deeper until he comes to a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazy and cramped. Everything blends into the color of fle No walls are visible; it is all billowy piles of costumes Brendan pushes in. Kara sits at the mirror, putting on eyeliner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing song) Brendan Brendan Brendan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dode flopped? (she makes a face) I know you two are cozed up, so you'll tell me or you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, getting feisty. (giggles) Last time we talked you were giving ultimate-tims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked. You went to Laura, didn't you? Told her my tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All part of your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turned out to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so cheap and used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gol, I must seem a real cad. Sometimes I just hate myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara grins dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to us, Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dode flopped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were a pair and a half for a few months, weren't we? Sometimes I miss having someone I can talk to. You ever miss having someone? I guess you must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's face is a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to hear Dode's tale about Emily. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly) You better be sure you wanna know whatcha wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Laura's working with me now, and I'll have the Pin and Tug in my corner soon. The sooner I get the truth from Dode or the truth about Dode from you, the safer you'll both be. No? Pass it on to Dode anyway. Maybe he'll have the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sense to get out from under you before he gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan leaves without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's at his desk, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) So what happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we wait for the Pin's answer. Unless his crew spotted VP Truman's social call this morning, it'll be yes. I'd give us 70/30. If we're in I get under his skin and see what's what. You stick to Kara, keep your specs peeled for Dode and stay away from Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain is quiet for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's with us, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too sharp) I'll let you know when she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gently replaces the receiver and sits for a momen in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class bell rings, and the cage quickly empties. Brend limps in, opens his locker. A note falls to his feet. It folded into a star. He pulls it open. "TWELVE THIRTY PICO ALEXANDER". He fishes the old note out and compares them - different handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locker cage is now empty and silent, except for the steady sound of heavy footfalls. Brendan looks up from th notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lug with a lumpish face is coming towards him. He wears black trenchcoat over bulbous shoulders, and his black ha comes down over his eyes like a sheepdog's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the Pin's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. The lug keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) So what's his answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer, not slowing. Brendan tightens his hand into a fis Then CLICK! and a long slender switchblade gleams in the lug's right paw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan jumps back as the lug swipes the blade at his tor Before the lug winds up for another slash Brendan is running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan runs through the empty campus square, the lug follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind rushing, sweating, the lug very close. Their footste clatter on the cement. Brendan swings around a corner, doubles back and stops with his back to a wall - he's los sight of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sweats, listening. The lug's footsteps echo throu the hallways, coming from all directions at once. Then it seems clear - he's down the hall on Brendan's right. Brendan dashes left. Wrong. The lug looms over him, his knife hand flashing. Brendan's jacket shoulder tears open and the white filling inside turns red. He stumbles back blindly, gets his footing and scrambles out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sprints away, down the hall, gaining about thirty feet on the lug before turning the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan drops to a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kicks his shoes off and clambers to his feet. The lug's footsteps are impossibly loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about to round the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his socked feet running silently back towards the corn The lug's footsteps crash like symbols as they both come around the same corner in opposite directions at full spe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slides like a baseball player, tangling his legs into the lug's. The lug pitches forward with frightening momentum. He hits the hall's metal handrail with his arms and head. A hollow gong reverberates through the hallway, and the lug falls like a puppet with his strings cut. A wallet with a couple of twenties and a student ID (CHUC BURNS), three hash pipes, fifteen joints, a baggie of wee and a large brownie in another baggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan leaves it all on him and staggers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan breathes heavily into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck Burns, big lug with hair like a sheepdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yeah I know him, I just can't pin him to any crowd. He's definitely not muscle for anyone. He taps the Carrows crowd but doesn't hang with them. If you've got a guess I could check it out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin. If he's with the Pin everything's kablooie and I gotta blow the burgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check it. I'm in third now-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan spots the Pin's Cady pulling into the parking lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. If I don't call by three call in the bulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up and begins walking at a normal pace alon the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cady pulls up beside him, and he stops walking. The d swings open and a voice comes from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no perceivable hesitation, he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits beside the Pin. The windows are tinted and t car is very dark. The seats are pink vinyl. The car lurch forward. Brendan and the Pin are silent for a beat, not looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Tangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stocky kid in the front seat turns, and reaches into hi jacket. For a moment he stays like that, hand in his jack eyes on Brendan. Brendan's face is placid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tangles pulls out an envelope and drops it in Brendan's l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) That's what you'll get every week for your services. Less of course there's a specific job involved, in where you get sliced in with my crew. Square?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The Pin holds his hat in his hands, fingering th rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing a thing down at the Hole tonight. Know it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South of T Street, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sort of a welcome you in thing. Eight o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan climbs out of the car on the exact spot they pick him up. The Cady drives off. Brendan checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12:32. A phone begins to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. PICO & ALEXANDER - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks up from his watch and answers the payphone, holding the receiver to his ear in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I know what you did. I saw what you did.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice is low and garbled, filtered through something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone I tell, it would ruin you some way. And I'm going to tell someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you making an offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or maybe I'll just do you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hire another hash head to blade me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Originally the source of this call was supposed to be a m production we decided it was one layer too many, and iden Brendan's first line was overdubbed in post to say `Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need no blades, shamus. I just gotta squawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to see you sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Brendan replaces the receiver and stands still for moment. Then he inserts a coin and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. Keep digging on the Burns lug, but the main thing is to find Dode. He set up whatever Emily walked into, it's getting more and more urgent we talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Trueman was looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trueman and the VP?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just Trueman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asked for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not good. Alright, keep me posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bonfire burns about a hundred feet off. Figures jump through the blaze to thrash music. The Pin and Brendan wander towards us on the dark beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm going to start you on the dope circles, cleaning up the Turkish dues, pulling in the strags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Just to see how you handle. Anyway there isn't much else doing. I'm tailing out this big deal, but that's almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big time. Biggest I ever done, and there was a snag in it, but it's almost done now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost, you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over enough. You're gonna make me curious, being so curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the sand, facing the breakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) I gotta lay something out. You're coming into a certain situation, and I'm bringing you in sort of because of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 If ever you want to witness a look of pure horror, shoot tell your cinematographer that there will be an extended Turns out it's difficult to light up a beach without very Who knew. Shooting at sunset proved a fortunate and less

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I didn't tell Tugger to hit you for the Brad Bramish thing. Laura and I, I decided I oughta hear what you were gunning for before I made an enemy. Tug just did it, though. He was hot, and he just hit you. He's been doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got my best interests, I know, he's loyal, he just gets hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscle you can't control's no good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working for me, not Tug, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence. The breakers crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things can get, you know, it's tough sometimes. Twisted, complicated, watching all the, I don't know. Everyone's got their thing. (silence) You read Tolkien?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tolkien, the Hobbit books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His descriptions of things are really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes you want to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waves crash. Behind them, with no warning at all, a train shoots by. Tug stands with his hands jammed in his pockets, flashing lights and gleaming metal streaking and squealing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock radio blinks 5:34. The phone is ringing. Brenda half wakes and puts it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Don't go to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth period Trueman and the VP come in asking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they call your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. I got home late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there too, then. Meet me behind the library. I've got some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold gray morning. The Brain hands Brendan a photocopy a newspaper clipping, "LOCAL YOUTH HOSPITALIZED"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisco Farr was found on a sidewalk outside Pinkerton's Deli three weeks ago. He was in a coma, his stomach contained a sausage sandwich, a horse dose of Heroin and traces of Choleric Tricemate, a poisonous chemical found in laundry detergent. Frisco's still under

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and nobody's talking, so nothing's come of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OD?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the chem the junk must have been cut with put him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Bad junk. Bad brick... could that form of Heroin be called 'Brick'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it was a concentrated powder, its street handle's 'whip' or 'rock' or 'brock'. (fishes a note from his pocket) Here. From Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stay clear of Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell her to stay clear of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the note to Brendan, who unfolds it roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) I gotta get voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The note reads "Meet me at the southeast corner of the school at 9:30." Brendan crumples it into a ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) No. Tell her I'll be at the Pin's at one. Any luck with the lug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain lays out a local newspaper with Emily's picture "LOCAL GIRL MISSING". Uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain looks hard at him. Brendan stares off into spac for a beat, then takes the Brain's cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) (into phone) Mr. Trueman please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan compares the two notes from his pocket with Laura - distinct handwriting on each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) This is Trueman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing asking for me in class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing out of class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very deliberate) The VP and I needed to ask you a few questions about Emily Kostich, who you might have heard is missing. It's a very serious thing. The police are involved. The VP and I knew you two were close, so the VP and I came to ask you questions, but you were truant. If you don't have a valid excuse-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been cut loose. I'm not safe here. We shouldn't have met in the open. Alright, lay low, but ask on the underneath for Dode. That's all that matters now, find Dode, but do it on the underneath, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to have played it safe, but there's no time. The Pin's not letting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: anything drop, so I gotta push things a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just find Dode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird of prey mailbox looms ominously. Brendan knocks the front door. No answer. He presses lightly on the scre door, and it gives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Brendan crosses the warped linoleum and gently ope the narrow basement door. He descends into inky gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deathly still and silent. Barely breathing, Brendan goes the lit doorway at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Brendan floats through the room like a ghost, to t Pin's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, then with greater confidence he rifles through it papers and trinkets, meaningless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches beneath the desk, knocking it gently with his knuckles. Quickly he removes the top drawer and reaches d into the desk frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan draws out a stack of hundred dollar bills two inc thick. He pulls out another. Another. Another. Thumbing t stacks -- pure hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something creaks in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan freezes. Silently he replaces the money and drawe his eyes on the doorway. He creeps towards the door on th balls of his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still empty. Brendan creeps towards the stairs, passing other doorways, all open but for one. He stops for a mome listening - silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan enters the room - pitch black but for a small hig window. Brendan pulls the curtains aside. A beam of sunli spills just enough light to reveal a figure in the dark. Brendan jumps back, and his reflection in the large mirro jumps as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white bird nesting in the window flutters into the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks the large mirror into the beam of light, reflecting it around the room like a flashlight. More jun a mattress, then a strangely bare corner with a single wh lump in it. The white bird stands behind the lump, its da eyes caught in the bare light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird flies out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan goes to the white lump, a small brick of white powder. White chalky residue patterns the floor -- there were other bricks there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Brendan, in the mirror, something moves. Someone else, in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger. He throws Brendan across the room, then heaves hi into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What with the poking, genius?! Maybe you're poking for your bull friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a sap. I can't even face up at school, the VP's so hot for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well. Maybe you're looking to make good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking to find this big game the Pin's played, not to gum it, but just so when its tail jams in my back I'll know who to bill for the embalming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta ask him what you wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. He didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug loosens his grip. Brendan gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) When a gee I'm paid to side with won't give me the straight that makes me nervous. Makes me angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug draws back a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. That's understandable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug sets a country glass of orange juice in front of Brendan. He paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was ten of them. I don't know where he picked them, he didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we get ten kils of brock, there aint enough marks in the whole burgh to eat that. So he unloads eight of em up way north, even up to the docks. I don't know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was eight. So that's the tenth in there. We gotta break it into doses, sell em off round the high, maybe some by Shorecliffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the ninth brick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah yeah. There were problems with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, thinking harder than he's used to. His scar reddens slightly, then he jerks out of his trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUGGER (cont'd) (quickly) It disappeared. Someone skimmed it. We started raising hell with all the likely suspects, and whatayaknow, it came back. But it came back bad. One of ours took a dose off the top, and it laid him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, poor Frisco. You heard about that. We'll track down the rat. Just takes time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard something fell with Emily Kostich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kostich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet pause. Tug's scar reddens a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the Pin talked about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he might know something. Ask him. Tell me what he says, cause if you heard something, you know, I wanna check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen door swings open -- enter the Pin. If he's surprised he doesn't show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pow wowing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shooting the shat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just shooting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His big foot clunks on the linoleum. He eyes a very sick looking Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) You alright, soldier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan moves a hand dismissively, sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) So, Tug, I got a call. Someone who says they know something about Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily Kostich. Where she's at now. Says we'd want to know. Wants to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll meet him. Four o'clock. (to Brendan) Emily was Tug's girl for awhile. You know Emily, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard she's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe you want to come along too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has Emily got to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Tugger) Show, maybe we'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives a slip of paper to Tugger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) Four o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger glances at the slip, then slides it to Brendan. It has the symbol drawn in pencil:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horn honks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin calls after him as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan falls into Laura's idling car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roughly) A payphone, anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan throws the car into drive, and they jerk forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mobile customer you have called is away from the phone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slams the phone down violently and walks back towards the car. His legs quiver, and a coughing fit hits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hacking and spluttering he falls to his knees. Laura's ar wrap around him, except it isn't Laura, it's Emily. Brend spins backwards into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily kissing his mouth, her hair around him, but it isn' her hair, it's Laura's. Brendan shoots upwards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and sits up with a jolt. Laid out in the back seat, Laura dabbing his head with a wet napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barks shakily) What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down, Brendan-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a fever, you've got to go to the hospital or-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three forty. You've got to rest, you're feverish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws himself out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan falls to his knees, coughing. Laura follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back in the car, I'm taking you home, you're sick, you need-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps yelling that until she does. His head spins. BRENDAN (cont'd) Okay, you've got to, what you've got to do is drive around to the Carrows lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be up on the, the blacktop, the basketball field. So you've got to go by you or me to get down there. If you see anyone but the Pin or Tugger or their crew go down into the ravine, honk four times, long short long short. But don't be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Will you do it? I need you to do this. I need you, here. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her shoulders. A beat, then her face registers resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flat plane of pebbly asphalt with a dozen basketball courts faintly outlined across its surface. Brendan stand crooked, watching the barren horizon. The wind blows bitterly, and the sky is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a speck. Coming towards Brendan, across the field. Brendan slumps towards it. Closer. Still a dark dot. Clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's face snaps into recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode grins. He holds a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna stop me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing, Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you. I saw what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were with her, dead, and you took the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. That's all you saw? What about before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see who killed her before I got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face ashen) You killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the body, Dode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, I thought you didn't, but we figured out, I got the news on ya, cause you hid the body, why wouldn't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's 'we'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! You're always talking, always this and that smartso, you're gonna shut up now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill her, Dode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to talk this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode, I know you're thinking of Em, I know you tried to help her-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! You're gonna shut your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan staggers, the world blurs out for a moment, then snaps back. DODE (cont'd) put it over real nice-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -so I'm telling you now you're in over your head, you don't want to put your hand in this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode shakes the newspaper at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! She's dead, you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was she scared, Dode? She came to me, who was she scared of? I think I know why, I just gotta know who!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode throws the paper, which scatters in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to confuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't stand it. Your little Em. She was gonna keep it, it was mine, and you couldn't stand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had you pegged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved her. And I woulda loved the kid. I'm gonna bury you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's face is empty. Dode walks stiffly away. Brendan puts a hand on his shoulder, but shrinks back in a coughi spasm. Dode grabs Brendan's wrist and hits him in the fac Brendan hits the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright clouds, sharp light. Emily flies towards us, glowi then dimmer, her wings splutter out, the clouds turn gray and we are looking at Emily's picture in the newspaper article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls the newspaper off his face, lying in a feta position. Dode is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, painfully, Brendan hoists himself up. He coughs a splutters, barely able to keep his footing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He limps across the field. Every step is agony. The wind blows against him. The black field seems impossibly long, still he keeps limping forward, towards the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slides down the embankment, landing on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gathered around the drain tunnel entrance are Tugger, the Pin, five of Tugger's flunkies and Dode in the middle. Everyone looks at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence. Brendan clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dode here says Emily Kostich is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody reacts to that. Brendan's face is placid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He says he knows who did it. He says he knows where the body's at. (beat of silence) And he says he wants more money than I think the information's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That so, Dode? (to the Pin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So walk. What's the info have to do with you anyways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty, he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. And he wants cash on the nail. He's a pot skulled reef worm with more hop in his head than blood. Why pay for dirt you can't believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Maybe you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll believe it, cause it's someone close to you. Real close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin looks up at Brendan, whose face is loose and nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's hot, but it's Dode, you can't trust it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger's eyes are locked on Dode, his scar the color of r liver. Brendan laughs and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting my shoes wet for this. Let him milk you if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brendan) Stay. (to Dode) It's still too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. You won't complain when you hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger twists a stick in his hands. Brendan watches him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) So maybe you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had her against the wall with the brick -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my business. It's still too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with growing confidence) It's not, cause that's not why she was killed, and it's real important to you, cause the person who killed her's real close, and cause he's got a lot to lose, and he knows if I don't bury him by spilling to you I spill to the bulls and bury him for real, and he's really really scared - she had a kid in her and he couldn't stand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger springs like a cat.     He grabs Dode's hair and k his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stumbles towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug, it's alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug has Dode on the ground, kicking his stomach and chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug backs off. Dode raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug pulls the gun from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan yells, slips and falls into the shallow water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug levels the gun at Dode's head and fires one shot. The back of Dode's skull comes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rapport reverberates through the black tunnel behind them, and birds fly out. Dode remains upright for a momen then falls limp into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin's face is stupid, lifeless. Tug turns to him, gun hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) (thickly) Tug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger fires - dirt kicks up, and the Pin scrambles back. Brendan crawls towards Tug, yelling for him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug fires twice more, both misses, and the Pin is away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's vision blurs.   He stumbles and falls into the shallow water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning gently. Brendan's eyes open, watch it sleepily, then sharpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits up in the bed. Tugger sits in a chair bedsid smoking. Brendan watches him for a long moment in the roo dim light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sprung it on me, just. That's a hell of a thing to spring on a guy. I don't remember much. Laura talked me down after, said whatever, she knew her, said it wasn't true, but I still think sometimes. I think bout it being true. Bout it being mine. And maybe I did it cause I thought it was true. A hell of a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stares at him through cold, empty eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUGGER (cont'd) You up? You weren't doing too good there for awhile. Laura said take you, you know, hospital, but I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the stats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's just laying low. You're here with us, at my folks place. They're gone. The bulls got Dode fore the tide took his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, strong tide, would've taken the body, like out to sea. It can do that. But the fuzz got there first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUGGER (cont'd) So everyone's assuming it's war, but no one's said it yet. Everyone's lying low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan swings his legs over the bed. Tug steps in front him, staring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) Alright, I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So just lie low. Sleep some more. Laura, she said you should sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger exits. Brendan runs his fingers through his hair, steps into his shoes and hobbles out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten more kids dressed like Tug are cleaning guns. Brendan nods to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod back, not paying much attention as he goes out t front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a lamplit street corner Brendan leans against a paypho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you - what, man, have you heard about Dode-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you yesterday? I called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kasprzyk took my phone, turned it off. I just now got it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, listen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen. Is my name in the papers with the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Is it just Dode in the papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm going to be calling you tonight, probably late. Sleep with your phone on. Could you get a car if you needed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's late enough I could take my mom's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be ready then. I'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan kicks in the door. Kara sits in front of the mirr in a soft pink robe, a boy on the floor beside her. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan. Did you hear about Dode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scheming tramp. You set that poor kid up, you hid him, fed him your tale. You got info from Laura and held Dode like a card till you could play him. For money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan throws a chair. The boy stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd bury me at the same time, but it was mostly for the money. You got Dode thinking Em had his kid, thinking I did it, and that was enough for him, but he stuck to the money cause you had your claws in him, cause he couldn't come away from the deal without it and make you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, you're a mess. Russ, go get my shoes from the wardrobe locker, would you sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes, trying to look mean at Brendan. Brendan and Kara watch each other like caged rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA (cont'd) Still wish you knew what you wanted to know? If it's any consolation, it probably wasn't Dode's kid. It might have been Tug's, but frankly I wouldn't bet a horse - it was a crowded field there at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grabs a clock and throws it. Kara's mirror shatte revealing a grimy dark wall behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA (cont'd) Meany. You want my tale, Brendan? I still know what Dode was selling, but I'd play it smart. A quick call from a payphone to copland, they drag the tunnel and you're through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes very close to him. Her robe falls open slightly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA (cont'd) Five thousand. Cash. I know you can get it from the Pin, but even if you can't I want it by first period tomorrow, or I play my hand and bury you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away, lets her robe fall.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA (cont'd) Now get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's eyes burn. He lunges at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drama geeks sit in groups. The dressing room door flies o and Kara flies out, stark naked. Brendan flies out after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing your ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Also on the DVD. Fine retailers everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks past the bird of prey mailbox. A voice from the screen door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's paying social calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are the stats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stats are war, soon as the press heat dies. And if you're with him, you're with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug got hot. He panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug's been after my digs from the get go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's been anxious cause he thought if you found out he killed Emily you'd turn him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to get the straight, no roughing. I wasn't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. So he's a hot head. So you don't want him on your side, at least let's have a pow wow fore we start digging trenches. Maybe we can all walk away amiable enemies. What would it take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'd have to square everything between us. He owes me some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, but we can talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight. Let's clear it all before it boils up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four tonight. You'll be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes out of the house with her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (cont'd) I'll drive you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura drives, Brendan stares at the passing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (cont'd) Do you feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stumbles in. Tug's hands grab him roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a smart guy you aint too smart. I said lay low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops Brendan. Laura kneels beside Brendan, feeling hi forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was at the Pin's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's our go-between.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. So here's the sit. You and the Pin are going to pow wow, four o'clock tonight, his place. Take all the muscle you want, you won't need it. He wants to talk straight, and you're going to work with him for whatever he needs, cause you don't want war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin's sitting on the brick profits - hitting him now would be post. Make peace and wait for your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Tug. Smooth it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between coughs) Besides, he's got you on the Dode thing. War'll mean you vs. him and every bull in the burgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tugger turns away, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brendan) You going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Brendan stumbles into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan lies on his back. Sweat stands on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning dizzily from Brendan's POV. Then the fan is stil and the room is spinning, then the fan, then the room. Brendan clamps his eyes shut. A door creaks open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaks) Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura floats across the room to him. Her hair falls aroun him. Brendan shrinks back. She puts a pale hand on his clammy forehead. Brendan tries to speak, but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fingers slide over his face. She pulls off his glasses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hands all over his face. Brendan's throat contorts in hard swallow. His eyes are wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hair, her hands all warm and gentle, touching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan breaks. In silent sobs first, then shivering with almighty release he cries like a baby in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura lights a cigarette. They lie beside each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to make sure it plays out smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll play however it plays without you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to make sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause if there's war, I'm in it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's just, I mean why not just run away. Go somewhere. I've got a car. (Brendan gives a wry look) I've got an aunt in New Orleans, she wouldn't care. (Brendan grins) Yeah, it's a stupid thing, but think about it, why not? What, school? C'mon. Family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her smoke drifts into the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't serious, but we could go for awhile. Just until everything clears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan watches the smoke. She stubs the butt out in an a tray on the table and curls against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretching his arm across the table, he nonchalantly spin the ash tray around with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His glasses lay on the table. Through the left lens the cigarette is magnified. Pale blue arrow on the filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's arm stretches across his chest. He looks at it, t up at the fan, spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slips out of bed. A glowing clock radio reads "3:16".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swarm of silent activity. Tug's flunkies prepare variou weapons. Brendan goes to Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your boys no knuckle business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your folks left a car here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it and Laura's. (Brendan tosses Tug the keys) I'll go first in yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the scenic route to draw off any tailers. They'll think it's you, they might even radio back that you're alone. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Smarts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Brendan his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me fifteen minutes, then go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slides into the black mustang and gutters off int the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlooking a twinkling valley of suburban lights. Brenda talks at a payphone beside the curbed mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I warned you. Can you get the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to 2014 Clancy, off Pico west of La Grange. Park outside and wait. Laura's inside. She hasn't got a car, but if she blows on foot or gets a pick, tail her. Alright? (silence) Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you when it gets light. (silence) Thanks, Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK, Brain hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls the mustang into the driveway, limps up to front door and knocks. One of the Pin's boys lets him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded with tense looking punks, half dressed like the P and half like Tugger. The Pin's mom is shuffling about, pouring them milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several more punks from both camps crowd the hall, and mo lean in the darkened doorways. Brendan passes through quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin at his desk, flanked by two of his boys. Tug sits the center of the room, two of his punks beside him. Bren saunters between them and leans against the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want full assurance that any heat from Emily and Dode is gonna be on just you. I don't even want my name pulled in the shindig. Second, you owe me six Cs, no rush, but I want your shake that it'll come home in not too much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug's eyes burn, his scar reddens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tug) That's square. You did them after all. Lay low it'll blow over. Stick on this, one of you'll dish it to bury the other and you'll both get the rap. As to the six, did you borrow it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you owe it. Shouldn't need a shake on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug looks at the Pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright to both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Let's seal it up and blow for keeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third thing. The last brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks up sharply, taken off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That aint the point. I'm gonna start selling it. How do I know it aint bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was the last one? Cause someone got greedy. Tug here's had the means to swipe half and cut it bad for a long time. Now we're splits my loss of trust's retroactive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you, Tug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes hot on the Pin) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, so let's shake and blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug shoots to his feet, kicking away his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would be good enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna see him dose it. Just to prove it. Then we're square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell for that! I didn't touch your junk, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your not wanting to dose it's telling me something right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it better be! It's telling that I'm out from your thumb, that I aint playing lapdog to no gothed up cripple no more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the room is on their feet.   Brendan steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll dose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes to him, unbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it'll shut you two apes up I'll   take the dose, and if I don't die we're   all right as rain, and if I do die you   two have your war, so long as you keep   it off my grave. Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   Tangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug just stares at Brendan, then tosses his hands up slightly and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! from the next room. Everyone freezes. More breakin then scuffling and shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two punks look at their bosses, then run out. Tug sta to follow, but Brendan holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise through the wall grows tremendous, a full brawl The ceiling pounds and shudders with footfalls and bodies hitting the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from not too far away, a gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin stands and goes towards the door, but Brendan sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and slams it shut. A few tense seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another gunshot. Footfalls, then Tangles falls through th door, his chest red. The Pin bends over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) The brick, it's gone. The brick's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tangles stops gasping. The Pin stands, eyes blazing at Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make peace, huh? Talk it out? Get your boys in my den soes you could snag it under my nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug's scar is fiery red. He coils his body, snarling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it bad, Tug? Snag it so I don't know, or sell it off to flat the war odds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Pin, think about it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I did all that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug blows past Brendan like a train and slams the Pin int the ground with his fist. He punctuates his words with ha straight blows into the Pin's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUGGER (cont'd) I cut the brick, I stole the money, I faked a peace, I snagged your junk, I did it all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan shouts and throws himself on Tug's arm, wrenching sideways. The gun clunks onto the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin flips Tug   over and for a moment Brendan is caug between them, hit   and torn, rolling over the gun. Tug g it, Brendan grabs   his wrist and the gun goes off, firin into the ceiling.   Plaster sprays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan screams, thrashing wildly, and manages to slip ou of his bloodied jacket and out from between the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pin is on top, pinning Tug's gun hand to the carpet, straining to keep it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan leaps to his feet, staggers, then winds up and ki Tug in the wrist with all his strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrible crunching popping sound. Tug roars. Brendan ta the gun from his limp hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan backs off a few steps. The Pin strains to keep Tu down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIN (cont'd) Do him now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stumbles back. Tug roars, flips the Pin over and beats his face mercilessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stumbles out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. From the darkened doorways and the thin ceiling relentless sounds of fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks backwards as if in a trance, eyes glued to Pin's door. Inside wild shadows splay across the walls, a the Pin shouts Brendan's name. Light flashes from another darkened doorway and the wall beside Brendan splinters. Brendan spins on his heel and fires three shots into the darkness, which falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the gun back on the Pin's doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a spray of sparks the doorway turns dark. They broke the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark doorway looms up before Brendan, inky black. Horrible sounds come from it, blows, breaking bone, screa The Pin screams Brendan's name over and over, calling for help. Pleading. Brendan steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time slows down. Brendan drops the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It thunks on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one motion Brendan kicks the gun down the hall into th Pin's doorway, turns and runs into the room where he foun the brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Brendan runs through, clawing past dark fighting shapes, running like a man possessed. He breaks through t darkness and heaves himself up through the small window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan scrambles out, slips on the grass and hits the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two sharp gunshots come from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is suddenly still. Brendan stands slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a light from the Mustang - the trunk has drift open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, a pale blue arm lies tangled in black plastic. Bl fingernails. Cheap plastic bracelets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan shuts the trunk solidly, then walks off down the street and vanishes into the inky night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later police cars pull up, sirens blaring, light turning the dark streets bright as day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning is cold and clammy. Brendan slumps against th payphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Library. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she blow last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stayed there till six thirty, then walked to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't give her a ride, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she came straight to school from Tug's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She there now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Not with me, but here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Tell her I wanna meet up on the basketball field in half an hour, then go home and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up, then pauses, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits against the massive gym building, writing on piece of looseleaf paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan slips the paper under a door stenciled "VP Office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold, barren. Wind whistles softly and jangles the metal mesh basketball nets like windchimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands crookedly, hands in pockets, eyes trained the cold black horizon. A speck appears. Brendan waits fo it, bracing himself against the wind.
