dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura. She puts her arms around him, a warm embrace. Bren draws back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Did you see it all? With Tug and the Pin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at her a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I took your advice and didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks at him strangely, a little uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers say six dead, three around the house, one girl in the trunk of Tug's car, and the Pin and Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's face is frozen in an ambiguous frown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tug tried to shoot his way out when the police got there. They tied him to Dode, too. Same gun. And the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good thing you weren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's face softens a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the girl was Emily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura embraces him again, and doesn't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) Yeah I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did all this cause you loved her. And now it's finished. (tightens her embrace) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pulls back, looks at his face. It is a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not finished. Tug pulled the trigger on Em and he got the fall, but the bulls coulda found that out without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pulls back more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN (cont'd) I set out to know who put her in the spot, who put her in front of the gun. That was you, angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drifting back further) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you. What, you want the whole tale? You want me to tell it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Tell it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, from the top. You had your fingers in Brad Bramish for appearances and to keep him buying from the Pin, who you were hooked with. Emily came to you and Brad, you saw her for what she was, an insecure little girl trying to get in. She goes on the backburner. Meanwhile maybe you're getting bored, maybe just greedy, so when the Pin scores big with the bricks you take your shot. You hook one, take half, and cut it back to size, but you cut it bad. Maybe accidentally, maybe to down the Pin's operation, doesn't matter. You put it back, but poor Frisco doses off it and lands in a coma. (voice strengthening) So now the Pin's fuming, maybe he's jealous of Brad, so he comes to Brad's crowd looking for blood, or at least a scape. You know trouble. There's going to be a war over this. And there's Emily. She trusts you. She wants in. It's duck soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You frame her for the bad brick, then you cut her loose. You turn on your heel and bite her in the throat. Last week on the payphone, Pico and Alexander, she saw something she was scared of. Tug's car driving by, the Pin driving, but she wouldn't have seen the Pin. No, she was across the street, angel. She saw the passenger side. She saw you. She saw you and ran like she saw some devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's face is very still, quivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, why are you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she took the hit. Dode hid her away, but the Pin was on to her, tracked her down, told her to meet him, that they would make good. Gave her a time, and a place. And sent Tug. Just to get the straight. But maybe you had talked Tug up, or maybe he just blew a fuse, but Em sprung it on him that she had her kid, and he did what anyone could count on Tug doing - he hit her. She took the hit for you. You let her take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to tell me it's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crumples against him, looking him straight in the eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. I've only helped you. How can you - It isn't true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sobs through a tensed, straight face. Brendan holds h stare, but his eyes are distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it isn't. I want you to have been on my side all along, not just trying to get me under your thumb like Brad and the Pin and Tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think you knew that meeting was going to blow up. I think that was your final play. But I hope I'm wrong. I hope everything I wrote in the note I dropped at Gary Trueman's office this morning is wrong. About your and Brad's involvement in the Pin's runnings. I hope you didn't steal the brick last night. In your purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathes) I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. That means you didn't let me walk into a slaughterhouse. You didn't lead Tug and the Pin and their crews to the slaughter. And when Trueman reads the note, takes my cue and searches your locker, he won't find a damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something changes in Laura's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trueman and several other men force Laura's locker open. From its dark interior the chalky white brick falls out, spins through the air, and shatters silently on the locke cage floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence between them. The basketball nets jangle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura steps back. She looks as if she has been punched in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) Brendan... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face does strange things, subtle contortions. She watches his eyes. He doesn't look at her. Her voice shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Well. That's most of it. 9 out of 10. I told Em to tell Tug it was his. Told her it would soften him up. She said she wished she could keep it, but she didn't love the father. I was going to drive her down the next day, we'd found a doctor. Most wouldn't. She was starting to show. 3 months. You know whose kid that makes it, or have you known all along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, steadily, she straightens up. Her figure takes ba some dignity. She steps towards him deliberately. Closer. Right up against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings her head to his, puts her lips to his ear, breathes warm breath, and says two words. The first is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (cont'd) Mother-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the second is low, guttural and lost to the whistling win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks briskly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan watches her go across the dark, barren field of asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metal jangles. Brendan turns to see the Brain hopping a chain link fence. Brendan turns his eyes back on Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get your straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I wouldn't have-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Chuck Burns came to. The knife guy. Spilled it all to the bulls, guess Brad Bramish hired him. On his own, just a grudge thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods slightly) Fits. You did good, Brain. Go sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brain starts to walk away, but turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BRAIN (cont'd) What'd she whisper to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called me a dirty word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you don't have to tell me. Thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As what-all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands alone on the asphalt field, watching Laura until she reaches the end of the field and walks off behind a twisted chain linked fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first period bell rings, and Brendan walks back towards campus.
